event: Birth of Kip Thorne, theoretical physicist whose work on gravitational waves transformed our understanding of gravity (1940)
Launch of Mars Express, marking a new era in Martian exploration and high‐resolution planetary science (2003)
Publication of detailed analysis of GRB 970508’s afterglow, linking gamma‐ray bursts to cosmological distances (1997)
Spitzer Space Telescope released detailed infrared images of distant galaxies (2004)
Ulysses transmitted data on the Sun’s polar regions, deepening our understanding of solar dynamics (1998)
Swift satellite captured an ultra‐long gamma‐ray burst, offering new insights into the deaths of massive stars (2006)
NASA announced refined measurements of the cosmic microwave background by COBE, reinforcing the Big Bang model (1992)
Launch of Venera 9, which later transmitted the first images from Venus’s surface (1975)
Hubble provided spectroscopic evidence of an exoplanet’s atmospheric composition (2008)
Cassini transmitted images of Titan revealing complex organic chemistry in its atmosphere (2004)
Report of the first confirmed detection of a soft gamma repeater (1990)
NASA unveiled the Mars Pathfinder spacecraft (1997)
Hubble transmitted images of the Cat’s Eye Nebula (1995)
Swift satellite’s first public data release on gamma‐ray bursts (2007)
Compton Gamma Ray Observatory observations revealed high‐energy phenomena in the Milky Way (1992)
Publication of a study using space observatory data to measure the Hubble constant (2009)
Reanalysis of COBE data refined estimates of the universe’s age (1998)
Launch of STS-7—the first Space Shuttle mission with a female astronaut (1983)
Viking 1 entered Mars orbit (1976)
Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter began mapping the Moon’s surface (2009)
Birth of Donald Menzel, an influential astrophysicist (1901)
NASA's Orbital Express mission demonstrated autonomous rendezvous and docking (2007)
Discovery and recognition of ‘Hot Jupiters’ reshaped planet formation theories (1999)
Birth of Fred Hoyle, whose theories transformed our understanding of cosmic element formation (1915)
Announcement of the first detection of a circumstellar disk around a young star (1998)
Detection of acoustic oscillations in the cosmic microwave background (2000)
Galileo’s flyby of Ganymede (1996)
Announcement of the first confirmed detection of water vapor in an exoplanet’s atmosphere (2005)
Birth of George Ellery Hale, the pioneering solar astronomer (1868)
Release of results from the Event Horizon Telescope, providing evidence of magnetic fields near a black hole (2018)
